xxl.core.spatial

Class KPE

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.relational.tuples.AbstractTuple
      • xxl.core.relational.tuples.ArrayTuple
        • xxl.core.spatial.KPE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Convertable, Tuple
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DistanceWeightedKPE, KPEzCode

    public class KPE
extends ArrayTuple
implements Convertable
    A KPE (key-pointer-element) stores a data Object and an ID. This is the key data-type for spatial data. The data stored by objects of this class typically contains some sort of approximation like e.g. a Minimum Bounding Rectangle (MBR) or a point. The ID can be an Integer or a reference pointing to the exact representation of the data Object. It is based on an array-tuple. The user has to provide a converter for the data object. If no Converter is provided the data object is assumed to be of type Convertable.
    See Also:
    ArrayTuple, KPEzCode, Serialized Form

      • KPE

        public KPE(Object data,
           Object ID,
           Converter IDConverter)
        Creates a new KPE.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be stored by this KPE (assumed to implement the Convertable interface).
        ID - The ID-Object wrapped by this KPE.
        IDConverter - The Converter for serializing the ID-Object wrapped by this KPE.

      • KPE

        public KPE(Object data)
        Creates a new KPE. The ID is set to xxl.core.math.Maths#zero. The IDConverter is set to IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be stored by this KPE.

      • read

        public void read(DataInput dataInput)
          throws IOException
        Reads the state (the attributes) for an object of this class from the specified data input and restores the calling object. The state of the object before calling read will be lost.
        The read method must read the values in the same sequence and with the same types as were written by write.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Convertable
        Parameters:
        dataInput - the stream to read data from in order to restore the object.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur.

      • write

        public void write(DataOutput dataOutput)
           throws IOException
        Writes the state (the attributes) of the calling object to the specified data output. This method should serialize the state of this object without calling another write method in order to prevent recursions.
        Specified by:
        write in interface Convertable
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write the state (the attributes) of the object to.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
